translations.translation: Disables the need for the kernel to update file access time every time it's being requested.
Secured profile: combines stability with an adequate level of efficiency. First, files are written and then all elements are wiped in order to ensure data stability.
Highly secured profile: Your file transfers will be more stable at the expense of performance.
Unsecured profile: very highly efficient, although very dangerous since the ZFS ignores synchronous transfer requests (BDD, NFS, etc.).
Administrators should use this option only if they clearly understand the risks.
The ZFS options will be modified shortly.
An error has occurred while modifying the ZFS options.
An error has occurred while loading the ZFS options.
